channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel’s Eurovision Campaign Went All the Way to the Top
item.description: Government social media accounts and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu joined a drive to encourage people to vote for Israel’s entrant.

item.title: Salesforce exec says rise of AI agents means ‘every job should be rethought’
item.description: AI agents can do tedious tasks better than people, allowing human talent to be refocused on more critical opportunities.

item.title: Karen Dunn and Other Top Lawyers Depart Paul Weiss to Start Firm
item.description: Four prominent partners are leaving a few months after Paul Weiss cut a deal with the White House to avoid an executive order that would have restrict...

item.title: Sebastião Salgado, Acclaimed Brazilian Photographer, Is Dead at 81
item.description: Known for his powerfully impactful images of nature and the human condition, he was widely regarded as one of the most important documentary photograp...

item.title: Iran-U.S. Nuclear Talks: What’s at Stake?
item.description: Officials said Iran and the U.S. made some progress during the latest round of talks in Rome on Friday.

item.title: Trump Signs Executive Orders for Faster Build-Out of Nuclear Power Plants
item.description: Among a flurry of executive actions, Mr. Trump directed the nation’s nuclear safety regulator to speed up approvals for new reactors.

item.title: Hong Kong’s Famous Bamboo Scaffolding Hangs On (for Now)
item.description: Metal has begun to replace this distinctive latticework, which is seen on towers across the city. Daisy Pak, a rare female bamboo master, takes pride ...

item.title: Iran-U.S. Nuclear Talks: What’s at Stake?
item.description: Officials said Iran and the U.S. made some progress during the latest round of talks in Rome on Friday.

item.title: Europe’s Been Negotiating by the Book, but Trump’s Tearing It Up
item.description: The Trump administration sees tariff talks as a chance to pressure a rival into concessions. E.U. officials have acted as though they were dealing wit...

item.description: Known for his powerfully impactful images of nature and the human condition, he was widely regarded as one of the most important documentary photograp...

item.title: Hong Kong’s Famous Bamboo Scaffolding Hangs On (for Now)
item.description: Metal has begun to replace this distinctive latticework, which is seen on towers across the city. Daisy Pak, a rare female bamboo master, takes pride ...

item.title: Markets dip after Trump threatens tariffs against Europe and Apple, sinking the iPhone maker’s stock by 3%
item.description: The president said he would issue a 50% tariff on the EU and a 25% tax on Apple in a pair of Truth Social posts.

item.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE is reportedly targeting the Census Bureau next. One expert says it’s likely to eliminate its survey about prison inmates
item.description: Researchers and users of federal data are grappling with broader concerns about the health of the U.S. statistical system.

item.title: Boeing strikes $1.1 billion deal with Justice Department over deadly 737 Max crashes—and must pay $445 million to victims’ families
item.description: Boeing will pay and invest more than $1.1 billion, including an additional $445 million for the crash victims’ families.

item.title: Trump touts ‘planned partnership’ between U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel, signaling potential approval of Japanese company’s buyout bid
item.description: As recently as December, Trump said he was "totally against the once great and powerful U.S. Steel being bought by a foreign company.”
